result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Joseph Pettis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
10-25-2018/ Judge Stephanie Rothstein
The Court ordered the JOC amended reducing the restitution amount to $894 payable to They Grow Like Weeds.
(The other victims were reimbursed pursuant to an affidavit from the Greendale Police department).
*************************************************

The Court ordered restitution in the TOTAL amount of $2,063.00, to be paid to the merchants as follows:      
- $90.00 to be paid to GIFT OF WINGS;  
- $200.00 to be paid to APPLES OF EDEN;  
- $1,271.00 to be paid to THEY GROW LIKE WEEDS;  
- $478 to VILLAGE HAIR (to Judith O) and   
- $24.00 to VILLAGE HAIR (to Rose S).

Restitution is to be paid first, before costs, fees and surcharges.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges; to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for the CIP.
Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the SAP.
Concurrent with: with Counts 2 & 4; consecutive to Waukesha County case 13CF823.

superMiscConds.notes: NO CONTACT with any of the businesses or victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution & surcharges.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Counts 1 & 4; consecutive to Waukesha County case 13CF823

All costs, fees, restitution and surcharges.
to be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds/ earnings.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
DNA surcharge to be paid on Count 1 and is waived on Counts 2 & 4, as they are related to one another.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two; consecutive to Waukesha County case 13CF823.

records.addlTxt: Counts one and two.
Count four.

As to COUNT 3-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Robert Joseph Pettis in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Robert Joseph Pettis in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Handwritten document listing read-in charges received and filed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

As to COUNT 4-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Defense counsel requested an adjourned sentencing date. Court granted defense request.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce
Victim Impact Statements with attached restitution worksheets received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Mark A. Pecora in court, defendant Robert Joseph Pettis not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Due to the lateness of the hour and defense counsel's calendar, Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on September 3, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed.

Attorney Mark A. Pecora in court, defendant Robert Joseph Pettis not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf Sara Volden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested that his client not be produced, as they were looking for another date.  Defense counsel stated that his client has a revocation hearing in two weeks.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court set bail at $5,000.00 CASH.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Robert Joseph Pettis not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Defense counsel requested a plea date; needs discovery and defendant is in custody on a Probation Hold in Waukesha County, pending possible revocation.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: REIMEN CENTER- 5602 Broad St; GIFT OF WINGS - 5608 Broad St;  APPLES OF EDEN- 5612 Broad St.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Robert Joseph Pettis in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Robert Joseph Pettis in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT HAS OBTAINED PRIVATE REPRESENTATION.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. 
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
